name: Crested Butte Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor and researching as best we could online, we booked three nights at the Crested Butte Retreat as one of two destinations in our honeymoon trip. While the reviews were great and the retreat's website looked very nice, we were not prepared for how TRULY wonderful, beautiful, warm, and accomodating this place would be! The retreat itself is in a great location and is so pretty - it's large and spacious, yet cozy, well-maintianed and decorated. Our suite (The Pearl) was gorgeous and absolutely perfect for our honeymoon - including a comfy king size bed, spacious and unique bath/vanity, sitting area, and large double-head shower, private jacuzzi and sauna - all with incredible views of the mountains, ski area, and the town of Crested Butte below. To top if off, the husband-wife management team was absolutely delightful and professional - they saw to our every need and answered every possible question about things to do in the area. Breakfast was delicious as we ate out on the back deck and enjoyed the views - relaxing to enjoy a movie on the big screen or playing games in one of the entertainment rooms is a treat for a couple or a family. We'll go back again - for anniversary celebrations and any other good excuse we can come up with! :) We highly recommend you book some time here - I can't imagine you wouldn't enjoy it as much as we did.
reviews.title: Can't say enough WONDERFUL things about this retreat and its staff!!!

likes.liked: — Professional and helpful staff, great location, beautiful views, amazing room with incredible amenities
likes.disliked: — Loved everything - can't think of anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights at the Retreat over Memorial Day Weekend. This trip was a birthday gift for my wife, and it did not dissappoint. The Retreat is in a residential part of Mt Crested Butte, about 200 yards from the slopes. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed (including a DVD player!). The common areas are beautifully decorated and exceptionally maintained. Breakfast was spectacular each morning, and the hotel management was very helpful and knowledgeable about the town of Crested Butte (just a 2 minute drive away).
reviews.title: The Retreat is Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would hands-down recommend the Retreat to anyone looking for a romantic get-away in the mountains, regarldess of time of year.
reviews.title: Refreshing Retreat in Crested Butte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three days and two nights in early April enjoying local sightseeing and checking out stores, restaurants and a museum in the scenic town of Crested Butte Colorado while staying at the Crested Butte Retreat during a record winter snowfall. On our arrival after snowshoeing all afternoon on the large cross country ski trail network on the edge of town, we were warmly greeted by the innkeepers with minutes to spare before the end of check-in at 6:00pm. We were invited to store our snowshoes in the heated triple car garage while the innkeeper helped us to carry our belongings to our room.
reviews.title: Exceptional Stay

likes.liked: — The service was the best. We felt comfortable and at home.
likes.disliked: — Unfortunately, there were a lot of stairs to the retreat. We definitly got our excercise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the nicely decorated, warm atmosphere and very comfortable Anthracite bedroom with a queen size bed, one of nine bedrooms at the retreat. Our private bathroom was spacious with textured stone tiling on the floors and walls. It had everything we needed and included very soft thick white towels and matching robes for each of us.
reviews.title: Loved the Crested Butte Retreat

reviews.text: My family (wife, two tweens, and mother) and I stayed at The Crested Butte Retreat for two snowy nights in December 2008 (booked nearly a year ahead of time) about mid-way through a big winter road trip vacation swinging from the Southwest through the mid-West. I had done a lot of research before selecting our accommodations in Crested Butte, and I was glad to see that the effort had paid off, as the visit to the Retreat was quite nice and a much more personalized experience than if we had stayed at the big Lodge in Crested Butte. We had the Butte family suite and found it (and the entire rest of the Retreat) terrifically well-appointed and comfortable -- and delightfully warm! There was a large room at entry level containing mainly a TV watching area (with a queen sleeper sofa and a twin sleeper lounge chair) and a half-bath and kitchen and dining areas and a closet with laundry facilities (with supplies provided!), and then downstairs was the main bedroom with a queen bed and a twin daybed and full bath (double sinks, toilet, and shower, but no tub); we did not use the private hottub on the outdoor deck. According to property managers Jason and Allison, the entire property was renovated just three years ago, and it showed (though we did discover a (likely new) small water-leak problem in the wall and floor in one corner of the main bedroom in our suite, likely from melting snow making its way behind flashing). We had a chance, too, to peek at all the other suites (except the Honeymoon Suite, which was in use by a couple we never saw ;-) ), and they're even nicer than the pictures on the website suggest. Although the views from our family suite were nice, the views from the suites for couples -- and from the common areas -- were much better. The breakfasts prepared by Allison were classic American fare, not the "gourmet" preparations of other luxury B&Bs but quite tasty and filling. We had good dinners (not spectacular, but pretty decent, considering the remote location) "downtown" at Maxwell's (a steakhouse) and the East Side Bistro; at a late lunch at the Brick Oven, we found a decent salad bar and an average burger, but the pizza (recommended by another shopkeeper as the best in town) was disappointing in quality (though fortunately not expensive). We really appreciated Jason's and Allison's hospitality throughout the trip, especially their staying a bit late on the evening of our arrival in a snowstorm to make sure we found the place and settled in OK. (I should also note that Jason's advice to me before the trip that I be sure to get a four-wheel-drive vehicle from the rental car company was extremely sound. I sure am glad I listened to him.) If all you're interested in doing is touring, Crested Butte is big enough for only about one or, at most, two full days of activities, but if you're into snow sports, you could easily spend as much time there as your budget permits -- and I can't imagine your finding nicer accommodations than the Retreat.
reviews.title: Terrific B&B

likes.liked: — Well-appointed, comfortable, spacious, and convenient accommodations; good breakfasts, and excellent host/hostess hospitality.
likes.disliked: — A bit hard to find on first arrival at night, but that's a petty thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Crested Butte retreat was the highlight of our honeymoon. The managers were welcoming and we felt very much taken care of during our visit. The view from our room was magnificent and we were very glad to not have to stay in a crowded hotel with a bunch of college students. The managers went ABOVE and BEYOND to make sure our stay was perfect. Having a hot breakfast cooked for you every morning was the best way to start off a busy day on the slopes. The atmosphere was very luxurious, with a comfortable "at home" feel to it which is exactly what we were looking for in a small town like Crested Butte. We read all the 5 star reviews before we booked our room and we were still blown away by our own experience. We will definitely be returning to the Retreat when we go back to Crested Butte.
reviews.title: Most Romantic and the Highlight of our Honeymoon

likes.disliked: — Extra bus ride to the slopes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great time! My husband and I decided we needed a mini vacation away from all the political ads on the television and radio so we decided on the Retreat. After only seeing the pictures on line we were so thrilled when we walked into the retreat. It is beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Our room, Maroon Bells, was fantastic! My husband is cringing, because of all the new decorating ideas I have from staying at the retreat. The decor was very inspiring and the view from the private hot tub on our deck was great. We happened to be the only guests at the retreat our 3 days, we came in between seasons which was great for all the quiet we had! We enjoyed movies on the huge screen in the TV lounge and the fireplace in our room in the morning. The bathroom was luxurious. We would recommend the to anyone, especially for a quiet getaway. It would be a great place to enjoy with family and friends. Our hosts Jason and Allison were so nice and made sure we had everything we needed. It was nice to wake up and have breakfast ready, without having to go out. We are looking forward to visting during wildflower season next spring, and for fall colors next fall. Thanks so much for the relaxing getaway!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Mini Vacation

likes.disliked: — Climbing the stairs to the car.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our fantastic vacation at The Crested Butte Retreat. The staff is awesome, especially Allison, Jason and Ian. They do everything they possibly can to make your stay as enjoyable as it can be. We stayed in the "Castle" suite and it was fantastic. The hot tub is on it's own deck connected to the room. We slept with the windows open, it was cool and wonderful...of course we are from Texas so we could not believe the temperatures!! The bed was so comfortable, the views are amazing. We can't wait to go back. Every morning they offered a beautiful spread of food, they will make you anything you desire! Try the granola. You won't believe it. I had to get the recipe before I left. Allison and Jason will help you plan your hike and bike trips. They are knowledgeable about different trails and their difficulty. They also know restaurants and shops in Crested Butte and Mt. Crested Butte. The widlflowers are amazing in July and right outside your window. We highly recommend staying at The Crested Butte Resort!!! You will make some great new friends and truly enjoy your time there.
reviews.title: Loved This Retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Crested Butte Retreat was a one night stop on our journey from Vail to Telluride in Colorado.It proved to be such a treat, I wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: An unexpected and wonderful treat!

likes.liked: — it was just a lovely experience-the whole package
likes.disliked: — liked all of it but perhaps steep stairs could prove a problem for some.

reviews.title: Loved Crested Butte Retread
reviews.text: CB Retreat was totally awesome. Jayne was a totally awesome host and made us feel totally at home (although MUCH better).

reviews.title: Ok, but not spectacular
reviews.text: Our every wish was her command and she treated us like royalty. When one goes on vacation, this is the way to go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The retreat was very upscale and the fireplace in the bedroom was beautiful. A hot tub on the deck was a perfect touch. The bathroom was large and spacious...and spotless. The home theater system in the great room was the best I've ever seen!!!
reviews.title: "A perfect relaxing retreat"

reviews.text: Jayne's breakfasts were awesome...we never went away wanting. If Jayne's still around, we'll be back!!! :)
reviews.title: Fun For The Whole Family

reviews.text: Having read all the '5' reviews on this website and seen the retreat website, we were expecting this place to be idyllic and the highlight of our trip. However, we found it a bit bland. There is nothing obvious to fault, the food, hot tub, etc are nice as others have said. We just though it lacked the 'wow' factor that makes a memorable experience and that you expect for this kind of money. One other issue is that there is a reason why all the photos on the website are the view looking towards the retreat, rather than views looking FROM the retreat. Mountain views are good but it also overlooks a huge parking lot and loads of condos. The website gives an impression that its more secluded.
reviews.title: Wedding Midst The Wildflowers

reviews.text: From start to finish, our stay at the Crested Butte Retreat was wonderful. We were given such personal attention, and made to feel as if we were coming home. And we truly did feel at home in this elegant, well-maintained spacious lodge. Our room was lavishly & tastefully furnished, as is each individually decorated guest room. We were shown where midnight snacks were in the spacious, marble topped kitchen, and enjoyed a full, individually prepared breakfast each morning, consisting of homemade coffee cake, fresh fruit, granola and yogurt, and eggs prepared to order. We ordered spa services and the massages surpassed our expectations! Jane and Gary extend wonderful hospitality to each guest. We can't wait to return!
reviews.title: A Retreat That's Hard to Beat!

description: The Retreat sits high on a hillside above the base town, only 300 yards from the ski runs. All rooms are ringed with large windows providing panoramic views of the surrounding aspen and evergreen covered mountains and valleys.
